overview: After completion of this subject, students will have the knowledge to perform and interpret clinical ultrasound of the breast, implants, surrounding soft tissues and lymph nodes and be able to write a structured ultrasound report. Students will have interpreted and written a report on 10 ultrasound studies of a wide range of commonly encountered breast and soft tissue pathology. Students will have the knowledge how to use ultrasound to guide percutaneous procedures on the breast and soft tissues
ilo: Identify the key steps required to perform a standardised ultrasound of the breast, implants, and surrounding lymph nodes and soft tissue.
Interpret pathology and write a structured report of the breast using ultrasound.
Identify the key steps required to use ultrasound to guide percutaneous procedures of the breast, lymph nodes and soft tissues.
Evaluate the requirements for training competence and certification of breast ultrasound.
generic_skills: Improved written skills and problem-solving skills

Prerequisites.content: Note: these can be taken concurrently (at the same time)

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Adequate visual acuity is required to interpret clinical ultrasound. A student is expected to demonstrate sufficient visual acuity to perform the required range of skills, including reading ultrasound images from a computer monitor.

assessment.brief: Interpretation of 10 case studies assessed by structured questions pertaining to each case
